result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua J. Flynn was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

records.addlTxt: 09:02 AM Defendant Joshua J. Flynn in court, by phone.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rebecca Sexton from Jackson Correctional Records, by phone. Court goes over motion by defendant regarding sentence credit. ADA Kohlwey makes statement and finds credit has already determined and no new issues are brought and requests court deny motion. Court questions Ms. Sexton regarding credit. Ms. Sexton makes statement regarding the credit granted to the defendant and if the defendant is granted additional credit on 14CF52, other matters would be reactivated and additional sentences. Statement by defendant regarding sentence credit and consecutive sentences. The court makes statement regarding consecutive sentence to any sentence at the time of sentencing and denies the defendant's motion for re-consideration. Court questions defendant regarding collection of amount due. Defendant makes statement regarding Act 355 and requests the court to order DOC to follow the order. Court denies the motion and states DOC is following the law.
in Support of Reconsideration by Joshua
the motion to stay appeal is denied

Case called @ 11:36 a.m. Defendant Joshua J. Flynn in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Defendant Joshua J. Flynn in custody.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Cts 3 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Mann - DE waives the preparation of a PSI. Statement by the defendant. Court orders: 7 year term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 3 yr IC/4 yr ES - consecutive to any sentence currently being served - 138 days CFTS. ES Conditions: AODA and follow through, Abs Sob, Not be on the premises of any bars, Not to ingest any impairing substances not ordered by a physician, 36 mos DL rev/ 36 mos IID, OWI Assessment, $2500 fine inclusive of costs and the DNA surcharge - Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP. Appeal rights given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
